Currently reading: Carl’s Doomsday Scenario by Matt Dinniman üìö

Continuing the series. Been a good way to spend my $.99 audible credits.

I really enjoyed this video. The cinematography and music are just so good.

kottke.org/25/04/004…

Finished reading: Dungeon Crawler Carl by Matt Dinniman üìö

Enjoyed this more as the book went on. It balances the terribleness of the whole situation with the right amount of humor. Looking forward to continuing the series!

Michigan Theater. üìç

Enjoyed seeing Explosions in the Sky last night in Ann Arbor!
Brown Pelican looking for some food
Found a family of foxes in a den near my house
History repeats itself almost 2 years to the day
Texas is growing on me
He did not like getting told off for burying nuts in my flowerpot
My dog-nephew Ryder will be staying with me until mid-August, and he has agreed to be a good boy.
Hello curmudgeonly friend
Pardon the leg but I had to show that this little guy was maybe two feet away from me.
First irises of the year!
Trying out some strawberry plants
The saga continues
I√¢¬Ä¬ôm thinking this is a dark eyed junco.
Last sunset on Sanibel for the year
Doesn√¢¬Ä¬ôt do it justice
Good morning! Happy Monday!
Here goes nothing
Just one more Manistee River Trail photo
Campsite number one. Not much you can do when you show up at midnight and there are no open spots.
California isn√¢¬Ä¬ôt the only place whose sky is affected by the fires. Take a look at this site for the full scope of the smoke fire.airnow.gov
What a sky
what are you looking at?
It√¢¬Ä¬ôs just one of those evenings
Caught her enjoying one of my hibiscuses. She was very patient and let me run inside to get my camera to get this. Pretty sure it√¢¬Ä¬ôs a female ruby throated.
yield to pedestrians in the crosswalk
new lens who dis
So many daisies
Lots of potential
I knew you weren√¢¬Ä¬ôt a weed
Thanks for fixing my vase arrangement Abigail!
Catalpa or cigar tree blossom
We were friends until my shutter fired.
Guess who has peonies??? I√¢¬Ä¬ôll have some pink / purples ones here too in the next couple of days. #aphotoadayjune
My cubicle neighbor was not thrilled to see he got caught snacking before dinner. #aphotosdaymay
Irises be bloomin #aphotoadaymay
Apparently I I need a bigger battery (or two). #aphotoadaymay
They√¢¬Ä¬ôre getting bigger! #aphotoadaymay

It√¢¬Ä¬ôs not perfect yet, but I√¢¬Ä¬ôm thrilled to have my home wired network up and running! Learned a lot about patch panels, punch down tools, drilling holes in walls (and out the other side). Looking forward to cleaning it up and moving onto the next project. #aphotoadaymay
Huey, Louie, Duey, and Gus (I think) have all been safely hatched. Their momma did not approve of any of these photos, and she made me go inside before she’d bring them their dinner. #aphotoadaymay
Anyone want any roving lilies? I have plenty go around. #aphotoadaymay
Feliz Cinco de Mayo! #aphotoadaymay
Does this count as a splash of color in an unusual place? @paige.sharon #aphotoadaymay
I have some new housemates on the way! Huey, Duey, Louie, and Gus. #aphotoadaymay

Today was a good day. Socially-distance socialized with some friends, finally made progress on a home project, and the weather was amazing. We’re gonna mix things up–if you can think of ideas for themes you’d like to challenge me to, leave a comment, and I will do my best to make it happen this month. #aphotoadaymay
Best day of the year√¢¬Ä¬îso far. #aphotoadaymay

I’m going to go out on a limb and say that they are camera shy. Or they weren’t dressed for the occasion. Either way, they were not happy.

LAST DAY OF APRIL! New challenge begins tomorrow! #aphotoadayapril
Momma doubling as a pillow and a tent. #aphotoadayapril
This one and its partner landed right outside my office for a split second. I didn’t get the other one, but I at least got this. #aphotoadayapril
This tree better bloom. Whole reason I bought the house across the street from it. All the flowers with none of the mess. #aphotoadayapril
I’m sorry I Implied two days in a row was a special occasion, Michigan. You’ve made your point. Now can we go back to that thing you were just doing before this thing? #aphotoadayapril
Two beautiful days in a row? I will take it, Michigan. #aphotoadayapril
At least it’s not snow #aphotoadayapril
Spring is in the air. #aphotoadayapril
Reusing old subjects for new material, but I√¢¬Ä¬ôm gonna use it til I lose it. #aphotoadayapril
The snow and buds just keep falling. #puremichigan #aphotoadayapril
Despite the fact the weather can√¢¬Ä¬ôt decide what season it is, it is still spring. #aphotoadayapril

I√¢¬Ä¬ôm thinking these will look a lot more interesting in a couple of days. Again I have no idea what they are and have done zero research into them. Hostas? Also this is being posted after midnight, but it still counts. #aphotoadayapril
My creeping myrtle is blooming now and winter aconite is all done. Daffodils are still in and so are… some purple stalk flowers. #aphotoadayapril
When you just need that ice cream and a good walk in the sun. Yes I cheated today and this was taken with my phone. Two strikes against house whatever. #aphotoadayapril

She’s still there! I was worried when I hadn’t seen her in a few days that she had abandoned the den due to the trees around her being cut down. She did not enjoy seeing me as much as I enjoyed seeing her. #aphotoadayapril

Even when things are looking up, it√¢¬Ä¬ôs sometimes worth it to look down. I don√¢¬Ä¬ôt know what that means. Anyways, bonus photo for the day. One of the last blooms of my winter aconite. #aphotoadayapril
Things are looking up in my backyard #aphotoadayapril
Oh hi there
I think I received a visit from a Merlin this morning.
Had a friendly visitor named Ned this evening.
Last day here, and I√¢¬Ä¬ôm resorting to hot tea to stay warm. Can you believe it hasn√¢¬Ä¬ôt even hit 70 yet today?
Not much of a sunrise to see on my last day on the island, but it was a nice refreshing scurry to the beach to see what I could see.
So much noise. So not on purpose. Just imagine it without the snowstorm and you√¢¬Ä¬ôd be left with soft red light filtering down onto an empty lot. #wishihadmydslr #yesfilter #somuchnoise
This is a Donax, a genus of small edible saltwater clams. Namesake of one of the streets on the island. Send help.
My parents√¢¬Ä¬ô haul for the last week.
What’s a vacation without a food photo? My first shrimp √©touff√©e. It was amazing.
Good morning, Lake Lansing! Getting ready for the Lake Lansing Team Relay!

First ride with a new shoulder!!!! (and since September 2018). I don√¢¬Ä¬ôt know that I can fully express what it means to be back to doing things like riding a bike or how much fun my little jaunt was, but it was great!!!
Shadow of the contrail!
Are you lost?
Gray gray gray
It feels nicer than it looks.
Had some slightly quieter walking companions today.
Wish me luck.
It is too nice out to stay cooped up all day.
This one got my vote. #artprize2018
They told us that all Spanish bartenders were gruff and all business. Wrong! This guy was great and didn√¢¬Ä¬ôt even speak English. Here he is comparing the English and Spanish menus with Josh.

To make ourselves feel better about the Sagrada Familia fiasco, we visited La Pedrera.

Got to the top of the cone and spotted a second one in the distance!
